data.title: International Antitrust Law & Policy: Fordham Competition Law 2009

data.text:
The product you are interested in purchasing is available on a digital standing order basis with a 20% discount option.

To complete your purchase, please select one of the following:

Customers who select the active digital standing order option will be automatically charged from their credit card on file for digital releases/updates, supplements, or new editions when they become available. By selecting YES, I WISH TO BE ON STANDING ORDER you will receive any digital release/update, supplement or new edition published within three months of your purchase date at no charge. After the first three months of your purchase date, you will receive a 20% discount on any digital release/update, supplement or new edition published. To receive these benefits you must select the option, YES, I WISH TO BE ON STANDING ORDER.

Your credit card on file will be automatically charged and you will receive an order receipt for the discounted digital release/update, supplement, or new edition without any action on your part. New York State sales tax will be included where applicable.

By selecting NOTIFY you will receive email notifications when new digital updates are available. This will also include instructions on how to purchase these updates if you are interested. You will NOT be entitled to the discounts available to active digital standing order customers.

The PDF products and information available for purchase on this website are either owned by or licensed to Juris and are protected by the intellectual property laws of the United States and other jurisdictions. Juris and its licensors retain all proprietary rights to these materials. PDF products are copyright protected to prevent editing and copying capabilities. Some products also limit highlighting and the addition of comments. All PDF products can be downloaded, saved, and printed. All sales of Digital Products are final. NO refunds will be issued.

You may cancel your digital standing order option at any time by calling Customer Support at +1 (631) 350-2100 or e-mailing JURIS at subscriptions@jurispub.com

This offer is subject to change without notice and some exceptions may apply.

The product you are interested in purchasing is available on a standing order basis with a discount option.

In order to complete your purchase, please select one of the following:

Customers who select the standing order option will be automatically sent releases/updates, supplements or new editions when they become available. By selecting YES, I WISH TO BE ON STANDING ORDER you will receive any release/update, supplement or new edition published within three months of your purchase date at no charge. After the first three months of your purchase date you will receive a 20% discount on any release/update, supplement or new edition published in the next nine months. In order to receive these benefits you must select the option, YES, I WISH TO BE ON STANDING ORDER.

You will receive an invoice for the discounted release/update, supplement or new edition without any action on your part. Shipping and handling charges apply and New York State sales tax will be included where applicable. Shipping charges are calculated based on the shipping method, the weight of the package, and the destination of the shipment.

After the discount period expires you will continue to be sent releases/update, supplements or new editions with an invoice without any action on your part. You will be invoiced at the price at which the release/update, supplement or new edition is being offered along with applicable shipping and handling charges. New York State sales tax will be included where applicable. Shipping charges are calculated based on the shipping method, the weight of the package, and the destination of the shipment.

All products are sent to you on a 30-day, risk-free return basis. You have the right to return any release/update, supplement or new edition for a full credit. Returns should be sent to JURIS at 920 Links Avenue, Landisville, PA 17538. All products being returned must be in saleable condition and received by JURIS within 45 days of the invoice date. If you do not return the standing order shipment within this time period, you are responsible for paying the invoice in full.

You may cancel your standing order option at any time by calling Customer Support at 1-631-350-2100 or e-mailing JURIS at orders@jurispub.com

This offer is subject to change without notice and some exceptions may apply.
